posts.post_content: The 6/2 stats may seem awkward, but a difference in power and toughness is actually advantageous for evolve decks. The high power ensures that other creates will evolve when this is put down and the low toughness allows this guy to evolve himself.

posts.post_content:
Okay, so normally for Evolve, I've seen creatures that have High toughness as opposed to high Power, but considering this is a turn 5 card that is effectively a 7/3 next turn (how the hell will you NOT play a creature with 3 or more toughness on turn 6 in a Simic deck?) I think it is decent for a common....  
  
Great for a limited play, but I can't wait to  [Gruesome Spectacle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Gruesome Spectacle) this card when someone plays it, mill them for 6 + cards and still have 2 or 3 mana left over to dick around with~<3

Excellent art and flavor - wouldn't want to run into this in Central Park.

Posted By: ArdentDawn (1/24/2013 2:03:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I misjudged this little guy. The 6 power on a five-drop is huge, and he can usually get quite a bit bigger. A Crocanura or Ivy Lane Denizen will get him to 7/3, a Clinging Anemones or Elusive Krasis will get him to 8/4, and a Leyline Phantom will get him to 9/5. This guy starts decent (and will usually evolve some/all of your creatures) and can really get out of hand. Gets really scary with [Crowned Ceratok](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crowned Ceratok) or [Sapphire Drake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sapphire Drake).  
  
Definitely not Constructed-worthy in any sense of the word, but still a decent Limited card.
posts.html:
I misjudged this little guy. The 6 power on a five-drop is huge, and he can usually get quite a bit bigger. A Crocanura or Ivy Lane Denizen will get him to 7/3, a Clinging Anemones or Elusive Krasis will get him to 8/4, and a Leyline Phantom will get him to 9/5. This guy starts decent (and will usually evolve some/all of your creatures) and can really get out of hand. Gets really scary with Crowned Ceratok or Sapphire Drake.

Definitely not Constructed-worthy in any sense of the word, but still a decent Limited card.

posts.post_content: It allows other to evolve, and get's evolved rather easily, but it's mana cost is a detriment. Be sure to run with mana ramp if you want it to be worthwhile. Fair card, but it is above the cost-to-actual effect (where a bear costs ![Variable Colorless](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=X&type=symbol)![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) for 2/2 vanilla, this, for ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol) more has +4 power (already above it) with a keyword), but the actual cost isn't great. I'd almost say this is better in Gruul and Selesnyan decks.
posts.html:
It allows other to evolve, and get's evolved rather easily, but it's mana cost is a detriment. Be sure to run with mana ramp if you want it to be worthwhile. Fair card, but it is above the cost-to-actual effect (where a bear costs for 2/2 vanilla, this, for more has +4 power (already above it) with a keyword), but the actual cost isn't great. posts.post_content: A 6/2 for 5-mana is about right for a green common that will never see play unless someone's truly desperate for Limited fodder. I'm not convinced slapping a poorly-designed mechanic on it will cause it to become less unplayable however. I suppose we'll have to see if Evolve makes a splash or if, as I presume, it's merely another unwieldy keyword that says too much and does too little.
